comments:
Amazing customer service & the food is so fresh & tastes amazing! I'm vegan and the staff allowed me to sample all of there vegan options before I ordered!  He ended up allowing me to do half and half of the two dishes I liked most! Half coconut soy, half bbq soy, with rice & peas & cabbage for just $9! I am definitely a new regular!
        Was this review …?

Good food. Portion sizes are decent. I always get brown stew chicken (the gravy is yummy), rice and peas, and fried plantains. The meat falls off the bone every time. I won't order the cabbage again, had an odd taste to me. Try a johnny cake, they are quite different. The line can get long, so be patient. A lot of people will walk up and peek at the food since they're not very familiar with it. Just say excuse me and do so; that way when it's your turn to order, you're not standing there holding up the line. They have regular sodas, Jamaican beverages, bottled water and juices. There are a few desserts available too. I really enjoy the music while I'm eating, good vibes. Stop by if you want some good Jamaican food in Nashville. Parking can be a bit challenging during busier times (lunch time), so be prepared.
        Was this review …?

The food here is absolutely delicious! I love the oxtails and with rice and peas. Cabbage and cornbread is unbelievable! It can be a little pricey and the line can be wrapped around the restaurant. But I'm willing to stand in the line as I have never been disappointed with my food or the service.
        Was this review …?

I am a vegan and my husband is not.  Going to a new city and trying to figure out what we can both enjoy can be a challenge.  We found this place because it seemed to be great for both carnivores and vegans/vegetarians.  Everything is pre-made and you get to choose a protein and 2 sides.  Lots of options and everything looks great.   Well, the ONE thing I wanted (the tofu curry) was literally the only thing that they didn't have made yet.  The place had been open for over an hour at this point so it was sort of strange that they didn't have it ready.  The woman suggested I have the one other vegan dish but it was filled with peppers and onions, but I can't eat those 2 items so I opted to wait for the tofu which she said would only take about 15 minutes.  It was really more like a half hour, but I have to say it was REAL good.  I had the rice and beans and fried plantains as well (since those were the only 2 vegan sides), but I would have chosen those anyway.  Amazing plantains.  Not sure what they put in the tofu to make it so yellow, but it stained my mouth and hands for a whole day.
        Was this review …?

I always yes when someone invites me to lunch here. As a vegan, I always leave there very full. Their food taste good and is made fresh; they are always cooking and restocking the display. I always get the curry tofu or the jerk vegan protein with rich/beans and plantains. It is hidden at the back of the Farmer's Market, so you can't see it when you're in the main seating area. It has its own seating area, a door to the outside, and generally plays reggae music to get you feeling like you're in Jamaica as you bite into your fried plantain.
        Was this review …?

TL;DR: good spot for vegetarians. Got a stomachache from the vegetarian fried chicken, though, so maybe they use some ingredients that don't sit well with everyone.Food: they have great vegetarian dishes and vegetarian fried chicken. There's a whole section of vegetable dishes, but since other reviewers mentioned that their mango chutney fried chicken was good, I decided to try the vegetarian version. It was crispy, if a little bland, but had the texture of fried chicken. The mango chutney that it comes with is very sweet and added some flavor to the "chicken", but there's no mistakening this for actual fried chicken. Each entree comes with two sides, and I had the Jamaican rice and fried plantains. Rice was a little dry but had good flavor. Plantains could have been a little crisper outside but were soft inside and tasty. Portions are huge - I got a dine in plate and everything combined was a full dinner plate worth of food. Price: with tip, I spent exactly $10. It was super filling, and I would go back to try one of the veggie dishes.
        Was this review …?

Food was ok but terrible customer service. I'm next in line and the lady just walks off. I felt like she refused to take my order. She was popping her head around the corner looking for another customer. Finally some guy stops cleaning the floor to take my order. Did not receive a johnny cake with the order. The guy was polite but seemed new and kind of stressed out. That black lady who refused to take my order is a complete scumbag. I recommend the midtown location for good service and good food. I only went to the farmers market location for the boneless thigh. Quality of the food has went down over the past year. Doesn't have that authentic Jamaican feel.
        Was this review …?

What a great place to try out some pretty authentic Jamaican food and its attached to a cool farmers market! As seen on triple D. check this place out and try something new!
        Was this review …?

Boo. Lol. Seriously, when I moved here 5 years ago, the food was great. Now I won't even eat there anymore. Tried it again recently after 2 bad experiences in the past year or so-- and I will not be back! Meats needing long times to stew (beef,goat) are consistently chewy and not given proper time to cook. Goat was full of fat and gristle. The last 2 times, they were out of beef patties. At different times. Out of beef patties??! Unheard of at a real Jamaican spot. This place has turned into a Lon over rated tourist trap, and/or go-to place for people who have no clue what Jamaican food is supposed to taste like. Do yourself a favor-- skip it.
        Was this review …?

I don't really get the 5 star reviews. This is a meat and two with a little different meat selection. The vegetables are right out of a can. Shoneys food is just as good and much more reasonably priced.
        Was this review …?

Jamaicaway Restaurant vegan food was delicious! I only got take out but the food was so good (vegan spicy jerk gluten, plantains and rice) and the staff were very nice! I would definitely go back next time I am in Nashville.
        Was this review …?

Pros:  The food is amazing.  Delicious and on point.  Could rival any eatery in Queens and Jamaica.Cons:  The service is kind of crap.  No matter what time or day I walk in, or how many customers there are, it seems the staff is like Abbott and Costello meets Lucy and Ethel meets the WeebleWobbles...really unorganized, bumping into each other all the time, and confusing orders.  It's haha funny until the eighth time; I mean c'mon guys.  It's not that hard to be casual, yet efficient, at the same time.  For example: if you chose to leave your restaurant music on but perhaps turned the volume down, you may not muck up your customer's order (as well as when ringing it up), wasting your time and their's.(During another visit, I asked a younger female associate if she could turn the music down.  She looked at me like I just ordered sushi and reluctantly adjusted the volume).My bottom line is:  their service would match their food if they maybe focused more on the customers and less on they themselves "having fun".
        Was this review …?

This is a great little place. The ladies behind the counter are so cute and friendly. Very helpful and actually appear to enjoy their job. The line is fast but they don't rush you. The employees are worth the visit alone. I liked the smiles. I had the spicy jerked chicken. It taste better than the jerk chicken I had in Jamaica. The meat was very tender and the jerk sauce was delicious. The rice and beans were really good and was better with the jerk sauce on it. Cheese mashed potatoes were not that good. Overall a great lunch, quick and filling. Now go find a place to nap!
        Was this review …?

My husband and I ordered food from here through the DoorDash app, and the food was so good. We got the jerk chicken, greens, and sweet potatoes. I tried the carrot mango juice which is also really good! Definitely going to be ordering from here again!
        Was this review …?

We were so grateful to stop for lunch here on a leg of our road trip from Saint Louis to Gatinlburg. Exquisitely veggie-friendly, delectable food that tastes home-cooked and lovingly from-scratch. We ordered several items and loved each of them. The coconut-tofu vegetarian entree leaves me longing for more. We also engoyed the setting inside of the farmers market. We actually grabbed some incredible ice cream next door on the way out. Can't wait to get back to Nashville....
        Was this review …?

This place is amazing! It's inside the Farmer's Market and is one of the few places open past 4. Excellent dinner! The cheesy mashed potatoes were phenomenal, and I loved their spicy cabbage. I also had their curry chicken which was equally amazing. What a great find!
        Was this review …?

This place has promise, and I will be back to try more of the menu.  The sides were what really had me going this visit, the collard greens and brown rice (had some sort of spiced gravy going on in it) were awesome.  The spicy jerk chicken was decent, but not spicy and contained a lot of tiny sharp bones.  I love that they have multiple ginger drinks, including some very respectable ginger beer.  The interior is perhaps a bit too authentic Jamaican, all the way down to the torn up booth cushions :-)So the first visit was a bit hit and miss, but as I said I will be back.
        Was this review …?

Omg! Cheap but some of the most delicious Jamaican food you can get in Nashville. The meat patties are fresh and flaky. The cabbage is spicy and tender. The curry chicken and goat are perfectly marinated and tender. The oxtail are little bit more but so worth every dime.
        Was this review …?

I ventured out from my usual lunch go-tos at the Farmer's Market to give Jamaicaway a try today *pats self on back.* Guy Fieri creepily looked down at me from his signed DD&D poster and stamp on the wall approving of my choice. Most people in line seemed like repeat customers and knew exactly what was what and what they wanted - I was the loser who had to ask for a tutorial. Woops.  The line was a decent length, but moved quickly. I went with the mild jerk chicken (spice wimp here), yellow rice and fried plantains. Around $10 for that and a drink. The mild jerk is boneless, but the spicy appeared to have bones. Everything was good and very flavorful, but I'll branch out a little more with my sides next time. The greens also looked amazing and a jonny cake or patty would have been a good addition to my plate of mushy (in a good way) food.  Others looked like they had 2 sides and a jonny cake, so maybe I just got overlooked on that one?The atmosphere is nothing fancy, just a few tables and worn booths, but it does have it's own separate seating area away from the cafeteria-style open space used by the rest of the restaurants there.
        Was this review …?

This is one of the best restaurants in Nashville and one of my favorite restaurants of all time. It has become a family tradition since my parents moved here... The food and service are incredible! I usually get the the jerk chicken, fried plantains, and johnnycakes. There are also plenty of great options for vegetarians- the Coconut Delight is super yummy. Definitely try the Jamaican sodas too! I really love the Nashville Farmer's Market, so the location is perfect after a day of shopping. Highly recommended!!
        Was this review …?

I came here and had the goat curry with rice and cabbage.The goat curry was so-so. To be honest, I felt like it lacked some spice or freshness. Something. The rice was also so-so. I love rice, so when rice doesn't taste fresh, I am not impressed with the rest.  I would probably give it a shot down the road, after I have tried all the other merchants at the Farmer's Market, but I voted this place a 3 due to inconsistency or my mediocre experience.
        Was this review …?

Delicious food and a very nice staff! First time trying Jamaican food and I will most definitely be back!!! I recommend the mild boneless jerk chicken. Best EVER!
        Was this review …?

WOW. I don't even know where to begin. I went here for lunch and I was the only one in the building. The atmosphere here is cool. Awesome music and definitely somewhere cool to have a date or nice dinner.Peach tea to start me off was great. I also noticed they have natural fruit juice. Can't wait to try those another time. I order the spicy jerk chicken with yellow rice and plantains. She also brought me out some extra spicy sauce. I have no idea what exactly it was made from, but it was tasty. I have no idea how I ate all of this food. I went for lunch, but it was actually technically dinner so the portions were bigger. My eyes lit up when the food came out. I dove right into the chicken, dismantling it in search of juicy white meat. The server had asked me if I preferred light or dark meat. I said light and that's exactly what I got! I HATE pulling meat off bones, but this was SO WORTH IT.The meat was so tender it pulled right off. The yellow rice was SO GOOD. She had told me it was jasmine rice. I love it. I had never had that before. Mind you this is my first time eating Jamaican food. The plantains were the best I've ever had. I would grab chicken, sauce, a little rice. Have a bite. Eat a plantain. Repeat. Everything tasted so good. Another peach tea and I was finished. Jamaicaheaven seems like a more appropriate name. Maybe they'll consider changing it.
        Was this review …?

Delicious! Jamaicaway has everything you need on a chilly day in Nashville. You definitely won't leave hungry! I went with 3 other people to explore the Nashville Farmer's Market with a mission to eat some Jamaican food. It was suggest by the vegan in our group and she was super excited to try something delicious. Right away the smell of jerk seasonings pulls you in. The restaurant is tucked in the back corner of the farmer's market towards the doors for the outdoor flea market. The menu is expansive allowing everyone to try different things. I got the dark meat curry chicken with plantains and Jamaican rice. They offered to put extra sauce on the rice (YES PLEASE). Super cheap at $7.75. My boyfriend got the goat roti with plantains. HUGE portion which he was excited about. They were running low on plantains so they fried up a fresh batch and gave him extra, which was very kind. I believe his roti was about $10.The seating is cafeteria-style booths with hot sauces on every table. I appreciate that because I could add the extra kick I needed to my plate. Chicken - 5 stars. Super flavorful. Rich, DEEP flavor in the chicken from sitting in that curry. The plantains are always amazing, and the rice was the perfect side to sop up that leftover sauce. I ATE EVERY BITE. You can't go wrong here. Everything is good, and the ladies behind the counter are very helpful and have a smile on their faces.
        Was this review …?

Met family there for a Sunday lunch had the Curry Goat in a green curry sauce fall off the bone tender with steamed cabbage and yellow rice, all together we had 3 meals meat 2 veg and bottled water for under $20 can't beat that
        Was this review …?

My go to for Jamaican food. I've had the spicy and mild Jerk Chicken, as well as the Oxtails. My fave is the spicy Chicken, can't go wrong when ordering.
        Was this review …?

The food was fresh, hot and delicious. I loved it. A great taste of the Caribbean. If you're in Nashville passing through or visiting, I highly recommend this place.
        Was this review …?

Great food! Try the fried plantains for a touch of sweet starch with your spicy jerk.  If you want something a little different, try the Jamaican tea in the drink fountain; I still can't quite place the flavors.  However, don't expect it to be quick during mid-day. The lunch rush gets busy.
        Was this review …?

The best food in Nashville. A wide veggie selection. Spiced perfectly. Friendly and speedy service.
        Was this review …?

I visited here upon seeing it on DDD (diners, drive-in, and dives) on Food Network. I don't always follow the Food Network trail, but I remembered this restaurant in particular was in Nashville, and we were headed to Nashville for the Fourth of July holiday weekend sooooo why not give it a try? After having Jamaican food in Athens, GA at Kelly's Jamaican Foods---I've been addicted to that jerk chicken.Jamaicaway food is good, but not amazing. It's a bit overpriced in my opinion. I got the jerk chicken which was NOT spicy but was moist for the white meat. Cabbage lacked flavor. And the corn bread was extremely dry. It was good to dip in the jerk chicken sauce though. I did try the Johnny roll and wish I had ordered that over the cornbread. Butttttt I gotta stay true to my stomach. If you are truly looking for good jerk chicken that's spicy and full of flavor, bomb dot comb cabbage, and amazing cornbread---next time you are in GEORGIA try visiting Kelly's Jamaican Foods. YOU WONT REGRET IT. Jamiacaway is no comparison.
        Was this review …?

The food reminded me the time when my friend and I went to Jamaica. Although I never had Jamaican ox tail, the adventure side of me tells me I should give it a try. Well I'm glad that I did. The ox tail was tender and nicely seasoned. My boyfriend had spicy jerk chicken, even though it's not spicy, he enjoys the dish. Their side dishes were excellent too. I had the steam cabbage w Jamaican rice. Not only they have delicious food, the have wide range of drinks from Jamaica. We had the carrot mango and tropical fruit punch. The juices are very good, not too sweet. The overall atmosphere, is very relaxing and the staffs are very friendly. They serve you w a smile and help you with whatever you need.
        Was this review …?

Visited Jamaicaway in the Farmer's Market near downtown Nashville earlier this week for lunch with my girlfriend while I was in town for work. It was our first experience there, and honestly my first taste of true Jamaican food. Man, was I impressed!I'm a pretty adventurous eater, so I opted for the Curried Goat (with greens and yellow rice) - so not only was it my first taste of Jamaican, it was also my first taste of goat. SO GOOD!! Tender and savory. My girlfriend got the Curried Chicken with yellow rice and pineappled sweet potatoes, and she loved her meal as well. The prices were decent - I think we paid around $20 for the both of us. Overall, it was a fantastic meal that I'll be looking forward to experiencing again when I'm back in town!
        Was this review …?

Jerk gluten was a little to spicy, even eating it with my Johnny cake it was still to spicy, plantains and sweet potato was good. Herbal peach tea was great!
        Was this review …?

Where do I even start?! Stopped by around 4:40pm today to grab some food to go (they close at 5). I've had JW bookmarked for a while now based on good reviews and a sheer curiosity of never having had Jamaican food before. The guy working was so friendly and let me try every vegetarian entree they had out. OMG. I seriously had the toughest time choosing just one! I tried the spicy jerk soy, bbq soy, curry tofu, and another soy dish that tasted coconut-y. All SO good. I chose the spicy jerk soy, steamed cabbage, and he was nice enough to make me fried plantains. He told me the Jonny cakes were gone for the day but gave me cornbread and told me to ask for the Jonny cake next time. Literally everything was full of flavor and delicious. Spicy jerk soy was spicy but not too spicy. And for a decent sized portion of food, it only set me back $8.65 before tip. I will definitely be back (maybe tomorrow, sue me) to try other sides (which he said were all vegan -excluding the cheesy mashed potatoes I'm assuming), chow down on a full portion of another veggie entree, and try the Jonny cake. Friendly service, great food, reasonable prices!
        Was this review …?

So amazingly good! They even allow you to try anything before you order it!  So many vegetarian options and delicious sides. I couldn't be more excited to eat here again. Don't let this farmers market restaurant fool you, it's authentic and fresh! You know it's good when the workers are Jamaican! Love the different sodas and desserts too!
        Was this review …?

Very subpar food. The rice and peas were bland. The cabbage was just okay. The sauce on the oxtails was terrible. I literally scowled when I took the first bite. I had to wipe it off with a napkin in order to eat them. Several of the bones were just fat and no meat. I was very disappointed since I was really craving good Jamaican food. Maybe that doesn't exist in Nashville. I wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend it, I wasted $13 and a cheat meal. The music was good and the service wasn't much to write home about either. Try again Jamaicaway.
        Was this review …?

We were in the mood for Jamaican so we decided to stop by this small, but down home place inside the Farmers Market. We both had the spicy jerked chicken, and it was good (even though I would like it to be a bit spicier). It might not be the best jerked chicken that I've eaten, but it's good. I also ordered an extra side of ox tail, and it was decent. I would say that it's a good place to visit if you're around the area and want to try something different.
        Was this review …?

Prepare to loosen your belt a notch. And make a sequel to your first visit soon after. This buffet style layout has so many hearty, unique flavors and too many dishes to try in one meal. They have jerk chicken, of course, but the total variety of other flavors will expand your palate for sure. There are a ton of veg options too (the curry tofu, jerk seitan, and polite sticks are all vegan). But they have collard greens, cornbread, Johnny cakes, curried goat, mango chicken, etc. to fit any craving. I like the assortment of actual Jamaican beverages too. The owners and workers are helpful with any questions you have to help you decide. You can complete your meal with carrot or lemon cake, or a packaged offering from Kahn's Desserts -which I couldn't refuse. I love coming here, slightly over-eating, and then walking it off around the farmer's market :D
        Was this review …?

I've wanted to try Jamaicaway since the day I started work in the Metro Center almost 2 years ago but for some reason, I've had an excuse for not going. Well, I finally went yesterday because one of my friends wanted to go to the FM for lunch. I had the brown gravy chicken and rice/beans and plantains. The chicken was waaaaayyyy overcooked - extra dry. The rice and plantains were okay at best. Nothing special.... The meal came out to about $8 with a free glass of water which is comparable to other meals at the FM.
        Was this review …?

Located in the Nashville Farmer's Market, Jamaica Way is definitely a place not to be missed.Upon walking in, your first task is to read the large menu on the wall, try not to drool and pick up a tray. To be honest, don't bother with the menu on your first trip. Wait in line with your tray and choose a meat and two sides once you get to the counter. The employees are very friendly and helpful... They'll be more than happy to answer any questions you may have!Good go to's for first timers:Jerk chickenFried plantains or cheese potatoes Collards or turnip greensJohnny cakeThe curried goat and ox tails are also fantastic choices for a meat.Jamaica Way is such a a delicious and consistently yummy place for lunch. If you are looking for something different, but still has a hint of comfort food, Jamaica Way will not disappoint!
        Was this review …?

I've never tried Jamaican food before, but I've been wanting to try this place since seeing it on Triple D.  I'm so happy we finally got to try it.My wife and I both tried the Jerk Chicken.  She really enjoyed the mild and I loved the way the spicy woke up my taste buds.  Even though I got full, I left already planning my next meal when we come back.
        Was this review …?

This place was recommended by friends of ours while we were visiting Nashville and I cannot say how GLAD I am they recommended it! I got a small plate of the spicy jerk white chicken with collard greens and Jamaican Rice and it was AWESOME! Portions were huge, price was low, and the food was great. I highly recommend you check them out...I was pleasantly surprised!
        Was this review …?

I popped in last minute as the Greek place was closed earlier than expected.  The girl behind the count was very friendly.  I got the curry goat, greens, and red beans and rice.  They have me a ton of red beans and rice and a good portion of the others.  The greens and rice were tasty.  The curry goat was fantastic.  I'll be back to try some other options as well.
        Was this review …?

So many choices and so many GOOD food options in here!    We were driving around looking for a place to eat lunch and I suggested here.  It had been a couple years since I had been and my fiance had never tried it.   He's always looking for new and spicy things to try!We ordered a variety of items to try and we were not disappointed!  It was ALL very good and we were able to get it fast and get seated immediately.    If you have a lunch break and are concerned about time, don't be!  They are quick!  You can get it to eat in or to go.  Very good food and reasonably priced!
        Was this review …?

We decided on this restaurant for the many vegetarian choices and were not disappointed. I had spicy jerk soy. It was delicious and just spicy enough to not overpower the flavors. The Jamaican rice was a nice compliment to the jerk soy. My husband got a spinach and cheese pie that had a light and flaky crust and a well-seasoned filling. We both had plantains-cooked to a perfect tenderness and sweetness. The Johnny cakes are a fried delight and the pineapple ginger juice is so dreamy. The staff was very friendly as well.
        Was this review …?

I think this place is a terrific lunch option in the farmer's market. My curry chicken was cooked to perfection: fall off the bone, yet still moist. It paired beautifully with my cheesy mashed potatoes, greens and johnny cake, all (with drink) for just over $10. I will definitely be back.
        Was this review …?

Everything was fabulous! I had the mild jerk chicken, green beans, mashed potatoes,  beef patty, and herbal tea.... All of that for just $11! The customer device was great also. Really great place to grab some excellent food!
        Was this review …?

I finally found this place on Yelp! I saved a business card I got from here. I was here 4 years ago. Back then I donated some money and got a meal that way. It was pretty good. :) Sweetest owner ever. Not too spicy.
        Was this review …?

The Good: covering all bases, from jerk chicken to pork BBQ. Same with the sides: red rice to collard greens. Obviously all very tasty. Good deals, about 8 - 12$ for a meat, two sides AND a Johnny roll ( Jamaican beignet if you will ). Fun foods: goat ragu, fried plantains, ox tail.  Better know what you want, quick service by some friendly employees. The Bad: Boring ambiance, booths could use a makeover. Gotta pay for tap water boooo. Bottom line: Guy fiery came and conquered, you should too.
        Was this review …?

okay i told my girlfriend that the nexttime i am in nashville i had to try this place and might i say dont pass this place up i got the peas and rice and jerk chicken and the stewed chicken and sweet plantains and the stewed chicken was the best this place will not disappoint
        Was this review …?

While this place has a bunch of nice tables for eating in, it also caters well to the to-go crowd. Got the mild jerk chicken with fried plantains and sweet potatoes, along with a herbal tea drink. I'm not experienced with Jamaican fare, but I personally thought the chicken was okay at best; it was a bit drowned in sauce and too bony for my tastes. The plantains were pretty good though, and both the peach and raspberry herbal tea had an interesting flavor (pretty different from just sweet tea).
        Was this review …?

Great food with vegetarian and vegan options. Great customer service. The food is very very fresh and different. Great find in Nashville. Filling and a unique experience.
        Was this review …?

Not as good as what was discribed on tripleD. The best thing was the peach tea and the meat patties.  I had the spicy meat patty and it was good.  The chicken was all stewed instead of just baked like I expected.  The coconut drop had a weird consistency.
        Was this review …?

This place is yuuuuummy. Authentic Jamaican food - something I have not found in the state of Arkansas (where I live). It's nestled inside the Food Court near the Nashville Farmer's Market. In fact, I was impressed overall with the selection of food options here (Mediterranean, French, Indian, American, they have it all!)Despite the kitchen being somewhat chaotic (they ran out of plantains and were scrambling for more), the staff was friendly and apologetic for the chaos. We ordered the jerk chicken with sides of cheesy mashed potatoes, fried plantains, rice and peas, and a johnny cake. The jerk chicken was DELICIOUS - truly awesome flavoring! Everything was just superb, really. Highly recommended!
        Was this review …?

I finally tried Jamaicaway at the Farmers Market a few weeks ago and can't figure out why it took me so long.When you come in you get in line and order from the people by the counter.  The food is out like a cafeteria line so you pick your meat and sides and they hand it to you.  Don't forget your tray and silverware or you'll have to push through the crowd and get it later.  Ooops.I tried the spicy jerk chicken with fried plantains and greens.  God I love greens and they were great.  the jerk chicken was spicy but not too spicy and was tasty.  Watch out though because there's some weird gristly/chewy parts in there.  Fried plantains were perfect - I don't get a lot of opportunities to eat plantains so I had to have them.  The Johnny cakes soaked up all the tasty sauce from the jerk chicken and made me full and stuffed.Good place to eat lunch when you are at the Farmers Market - just be prepared to be uber-stuffed and needing a nap afterwards!
        Was this review …?

Not sure if it's because this is the only Jamaican restaurant in Nashville...but the food was way overpriced and it wasn't all that special to be honest. It was my first time trying Jamaican food, but I went with another friend (who had Jamaican food in FL) and she said that she had better and it was much cheaper. I've had food from Trinidad, islander food, and  I have to agree...it could've been better for what I paid for. So meh, I will not be coming back.
        Was this review …?

Decided the night before to take a group of friends here. We planned our day around a trip to Jamaicaway. I never once thought I would need to call and see if this place was open on a Saturday...A SATURDAY.  They're located at a Farmer's Market...why are they closed on a Saturday?I am sure they're food is good but I'll never know. I live 600 miles away.
        Was this review …?

If you're in the mood for a little sweet and spicy, head on over to Jamaicaway. The coconut delight, curry chicken and spicy jerk chicken are delicious. You must get the Jonny cakes! Most of the entrees are under $10 so it's very affordable.
        Was this review …?

Food was very tasty and portion was nice. I ordered the medium Jerk chicken and it was EXTREMELY tender and flavorful. Johnny cake was good, I wish I would have  saved it to soak the juices up off my plate when I finished but it didn't last that long! Service was so so, they sort of seemed understaffed but all in all a good place to eat if you are in the area. I wouldn't drive out of my way for it but would prob eat here again.
        Was this review …?

Well I was disappointed this time..I got the Oxtail.. well since I never had it before it is hard for me to compare it with it in the past... I didn't like it.. It was to difficult to eat.... tasted like old beef stew and was over priced.. the corn bread tasted and smelt old.. This review is a whole lot different than the first time I ate here..  that time it was a great experience. . I am not sure if I will be giving this another chance..
        Was this review …?

Went here a fews weeks ago! Really enjoyed the food . Great customer service and friendly environment. Every Time  I go I get great service I will always recommend this spot.

Located within the Farmer's Market, Jamaicaway is a great lunch spot.They offer lunch specials which come with a meat, 2 sides, and bread for around $10-$12.  Their offerings are true to what I know of and have tasted of Jamaican cuisine, and they are done well.  The staff is courteous and friendly.I had the curry goat which was tender and well seasoned.  (I just want to put in a plug here for goat - you don't see it very often on menus here, but it is delicious!  I will never really consider myself a 'foodie' bc I do shy away from offal, but I would encourage anyone who is curious to give goat a try!)   For sides, I had plantains which were well fried - crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, and callalou - which is a delicious green, very similar to spinach, but very hard to find in the states.  (if you ever see callalou soup on a menu, it is a must-try) When I inquired, the staff told me they have to get their callalou from Atlanta.   To complete the meal, I had a johnnie cake, which is essentially a tasty piece of fried dough.  This place makes me wish I was in the area for lunch more often.

Tucked away in the Farmer's Market, this place serves cheap, delicious Jamaican food.  By far their most popular item seems to be the chicken, which may come spicy, BBQ, or in jerk, curry brown sauce, or with mango chutney.  While the chicken dishes all seem to be chunks of chicken (with bone) immersed in their respective sauces, the meat is tender, and the sauces are deliciously thick, and strong, the brown sauce having a slight sweetness to it, while the spicy sauces have a fairly mild but respectable kick. Other dishes include a Tilapia escoveitch cooked while you wait that comes off quite tender and crumbly, if a little watery, and has a distinct sweet and sour-like sauce to it, as well as curried goat and ox-tails, which I have not gotten around to trying.  All dishes come two sides, which range from three varieties of rice (rice with beans, rice with peas, yellow rice) to fried plantains, various greens (from reallly bitter callaloo to thick turnip greens to green beans), and mashed or sweet potatoes.  A side dish of rice is nearly necessary to counteract the strong flavors of the chicken or fish.  All dishes also come with a choice of Johnny cake or corn bread, which also helps counteract the intense flavors. The Johnny cake comes nearly fresh out of the oven and is hot and crumbly like a very soft biscuit. With a drink, including various Caribbean sodas and  herbal fruit teas, it is just about $10-$15 for a good meal. The restaurant has somewhat odd hours, and is basically a glorified cafeteria. The staff however are friendly and helpful despite the bustle that surrounds them. Jamaicaway seems especially popular on Sundays after church and can get quite crowded at that point, though that is probably also the best time to visit.  Go early, like when it opens at around 11, to beat the crowds and get first dibs on the freshly made dishes. If you have not tried Jamaican food, I think this is a great place to start.

I really really want to like Jamaicaway, since my mother is from Trinidad so I grew up on many Caribbean staples that are pretty difficult to find anywhere else in Nashville. This is the only place where I can routinely get a goat curry wrapped in a roti or some oxtail, so for that reason alone, I'd probably give it a pass.But the problem with places that feature food that reminds me of my childhood is that I'm going to have a pretty high bar set and I can't honestly say that Jamaicaway is hitting that bar. While I appreciate how tender they get their goat, I sometimes feel like the spicing is off in the curry base, and if you're going to get the goat roti (which is essentially like a big burrito filled with goat curry), it would be nice to only have boneless meat in there, otherwise you are in for a nasty surprise. My other qualm is with the callalloo, which they make using turnip and other various greens, which is just not the way it's meant to be done. Callalloo is a plant that is very similar to spinach and while you can make it with other greens, it won't officially be callalloo in my book if you do so. Additionally, I hate that they use all the parts of the greens they do use, meaning that you get bunches of undigestible and unplatable fibrous bits that are a bit like chewing bamboo. Not pleasant at all.Also, I don't want to fault Jamaicaway on being successful, but I think it is fair to say that if you come during the lunch hour, this place will be busy and service will suffer for it. Even though it's cafeteria style, the line always seems to stall, especially as I always seem to wind up behind someone who is ordering 5 or 6 meals to go. I do find the hours pretty inconvenient as well, as this is yet another one of those Nashville restaurants that only seems to be open for lunch or an extremely early dinner. I also think that the food is a little bit pricey, personally. Maybe if their goat roti were the best I'd ever had I could see spending $11 on it, but I've had better for a fraction of that price. The portions are generous, but I generally find that I don't want to eat my entire meal because the flavor just doesn't have the proper refinement.I appreciate that Jamaicaway is filling a niche here in Nashville, and for that I give it some extra points, but whenever I go, I can't help but wish it were better. I guess that like authentic Chinese food, I'll just have to wait for the Caribbean flavors I know to make it to Nashville.

I am totally a fan of Jamaicaway Restaurant.  It's hidden in the Farmer's Market building behind the Capitol.  But, it's worth the trek.  At lunch time this place gets packed, so keep your eyes peeled for a table.  But, don't loose focus.  When it's your turn at the front of the line you must not hesitate.  Hesitation will kill your momentum - like it did mine on my first trip.  It's almost like a classic meat & three place where everything is pre-prepared and you peruse and select.  I started out with the traditional jerk chicken.  I chose the mild, but would have probably preferred the spicy better.  I've also had the curried goat - which was both frightening and exciting.  Both meals turned out really well and I would totally recommend this place for a lunch-time visit.  The sides are pretty varied too.  I've tried everything from fried plantains to sweet potatoes and steamed greens.  I will say that I was a little disappointed with their johnny cakes though, not much flavor.All in all, Jamaicaway is a really good lunch-time value.  It's busy, but not too crowded, and parking is super easy.  Go, try something new.
        Was this review …?

I've been here twice. The staff is friendly and helpful. They gave me samples with a toothpick. They had several main dishes for vegetarians, the BBQ tofu was tasty. The sides were simple but delicious, I tried the collard greens and cabbage. The fried bread is great to wipe up all the tasty sauce. They serve good sized portions at a reasonable price. The line gets long quickly at lunchtime.
        Was this review …?

Good fresh "fast" food.  Jamaicaway is laid out "foot court style", in that the hot dishes are presented behind glass and are scooped onto your plate right in front of you as you order it.  With the exception of what I ordered today, which was the Spicy Curry Gluten (as in wheat gluten, as in seitan).  It wasn't quite ready, so the man behind the counter told me he'd deliver my food to my table.  He did.  With the curry I had friend plantains and stewed almost Indian-like cabbage.  And a johnnycake, which I will explain later.Jamaicaway has an enticing selection of meat dishes (oxtail, goat, and chicken) with an additionally enticing variety of vegetarian dishes. (Tofu, gluten, etc.).  The price of an entree with two sides was a little under $9.  Pretty good.  Sides include but are not limited to plantains, cabbage, collard greens, sweet potato and pineapple, and different rice preparations.The johnnycake... I suppose I expected an American johnnycake, a pancake flap jack thing.  Was I wrong.. each meal was served with a johnnycake, a palm size piece of deep-fried, dense dough.  Woah.  I'm glad I tried it, but another may kill me.  Small, not a fantastic choice for a huge group of people.  Try Jamaicaway.  Especially if you are vegetarian, as you will appreciate the dishes that honestly do cater to you.
        Was this review …?

I went for the first time today and I will be back and take friends with me!I had the brown stew chicken with the pineappled sweet potatoes and rice and peas.  It was all great. If you have a cinnamon allergy you shouldn't have these choices.  The cinnamon isn't overpowering at all but it is there.   The herbal fruit tea was very sweet but they were very nice and brewed us up some unsweet.  The atmosphere was great for lunch.

I'm nowhere near a Jamaican food expert, but what a tasty lunch this was! I tried the jerk chicken (fall off the bone tender!), plantains (perfect crunch), collared greens (perfectly cooked and seasoned), and johnny cake (mmmmm). Wish I could go back and try more on the menu!

I stumbled upon Jamicaway last week while I was looking for glass-bottled Ting for my boyfriend. We had just come back from a great vacation in Negril, Jamaica from Christmas/New Years. When I walked into Jamaicaway, I was incredibly excited to see not only the Ting that he had drank every night while we were there, but the Beef and Chicken patties we snacked on late at night.  I looked over the assortment of food being served, and one of the women behind the counter was very friendly about explaining how one went about ordering, but I knew all I wanted was a Beef pattie(spicy was the only was to go in Jamaica!). I walked to my car and took a bite and closed my eyes and I was back on the beach!!!! This place is awfully authentic, while there was quite a crowd, the staff knew just how to handle them and got them in and out quickly.

Four stars is probably a lot for any fast food place, but whatever. Visiting Nashville from NYC for work, cookout is across from my hotel, went in at 11pm in a Tuesday. Lunch round up for the office. We were on a mission to 3 total places and stopped here first. Lunch drive thru busy. Inside busy. One reviewer stated the lunch does not do the volume the late night cravers do when in needed of munchies. THEN THAT should mean this place is CRAZY at night. It was consistently busy. Menu is extensive in a fast food way, BUT there is a catch. GET the 4.99 TRAY. Easy Peasy. Get the main meal, hamburger, or double hamburger 2 hot dogs, quesadilla chicken or beefy, BBQ, chicken sandwich, spicy reg or cajun, bbq and strips. Then get 2 sides, which are quite large. Could be fries or Coleslaw, quesadilla, hush puppies, onion rings, chicken wrap, corn dog, bacon wrap. AND then a LARGE Drink. Sweet tea or Unsweet Tea or Soda, bottle water, cheer wine or add 1 dollar for shake. All in a box to go. NOW really?!?!? You have to at least try this concept. So changed my ideas for lunch and ordered the double burger. It was really really flat. I guess I expected a little thicker like In and OUT. Nope smash down flat like wimpy small burger. Burgers are made to order, so had lettuce and tomato, both fresh and extra mustard. They totally got that right. Sides were fries with the cajun seasoning oher yelpers reviewed and 1/2 the box.  Totally made the  meal. 2nd side was the Quesadilla, chicken. Literally tasted like the Taco Bell Quesadilla across the street. I really thought it was. Both are 1 dollar if bought separate. So take away, FRIES and Unsweet Tea ruled the lunch. Actually not a bad lunch at all. YET,If you are looking for damn good burger, keep it moving, but Fries yes, Large Drink go for it. Service was really great and kept the drive thru moving.

It's rare that a fast food joint can pull off fast, good and cheap. But now I understand the hype that surrounds Cook Out. I got a "Cook Out tray" consisting of a plain cheeseburger, sides of chili and onion rings as well as a large drink -- all for under $6. With the "backyard barbecue" theme, I was worried my burger would have that unfortunate dried-out texture, but thankfully that was not the case. The burger was juicy and complemented well by the melting cheese. The chili was thin with a mild kick. It reminded me of a cinnamon-less version of Skyline Chili. The onion rings were fresh and much better than ones I've had from other fast food establishments. The menu is a bit overwhelming, but that's all the reason to make a return trip.

This is just a fast food type restaurant, but I am not from Nashville and feel compelled to review it because the concept is neat: The burgers seem to be hand-packed and taste like they were made on a grill, like the kind of burgers you would have at a small cookout with family or friends. You get to choose two sides, and a drink is included as part of the "meal." I chose the bacon wrap (which was a small tortilla with bacon and lettuce and sauce inside) and onion rings as my sides. The sides are small, but perfect to quell a craving without having to commit to a large, separate order of something. The burger was wrapped up in aluminum foil, as was the bacon wrap, and it was all put in a Styrofoam container. It made me feel the way you feel when someone makes you a plate to take home from a family cookout (as weird as that may sound). And I couldn't believe the prices: A little over $12 for two people to eat!

Great fast food at an awesome price. Welcome to Middle TN Cook Out!

Not a bad back up fast food place if the wait at Hattie B's is over 1 hour long. Honestly, when me and my group got to cookout, we were not expecting much, but the good thing was that the inside was relatively clean and the atmosphere was calm and casual. The ordering process was smooth and easy because there was almost nobody there. In regards to the food, I got the $4.99 value combo. This combo lets you choose a burger, 2 sides, and a drink (please opt to pay the $1 fee to get the fancy shake). I got the double burger and the two patties it came with were very thin and there were hardly any toppings added onto it. In addition, I got the onion rings and chili as my 2 sides. I was horribly disappointed at the portion size of the onion rings, I mean 3 onion rings? Seriously? If you want a side that comes with a bunch of food, definitely opt for the french fries. You will get a large handful of them (also the chili came with an extremely small portion and tasted like canned Hormel chili). The only thing that legitimately saved this disastrous value combo was the fancy shake, which is basically a heavenly milkshake. I got the cherry pie fancy shake and it was delicious (I should've ordered two). The milkshake was thick and creamy (decent portion size), it even had cherries inside of the shake. Honestly, it was probably one of the best milkshakes I have ever had and I highly recommend getting a fancy shake here, they have like 20 different flavors! Overall, if you are looking for a bargain fast food meal, I highly recommend Cookout because you will not be disappointed at the prices or with the fancy shake!

The signage was, um, less than exceptional so it was hard to know what to expect. They have a very busy drive thru and teeny tiny walk up counter with 2 cashiers and a place they give you the food when its ready. This is absolutely the bottle neck of the place. The tiny ordering place has a even smaller menu mounted at eye level if you are 17 feet tall.The vibe is VERY fast food with plastic booths that are better than say, McDonalds?, and there is counter with stools on either side and and a charging station in the middle. Okay....now to the good part. Food. I got a bbq burger thing, onion rings, fries and a shake. Don't judge me people! I was sharing and I NEEDED to eat those onion rings so Yelp could know! Onion rings - actual onions. Like yummy onions in crunchyness, fries - meh. A little floppy but a mash up of homestyle friens that are on the greasy side. Hamburger - totally solid fast food burger, tasty bun. And the shake. Holy mother....the shake. That thing was amazeballs. Like flip it upside down and it ain't moving thick deliciousness. And like 300 flavors (hello....hard to figure it all out for us wee people not 17 feet tall). So add on my buddies shake and burger, another shake to take back to a co-worker and this whole stinking mess of calories tallies up to $18.41Take that Catbird Seat. You can have dinner here for two every day for a MONTH for the price of 2 dining there. Okay, you could eat dog food too, so this is probably a bad comparison.Bottom line: Awesome shakes, clean, INEXPENSIVE and way better than a burger I've had at a fast food place.Oh, and my undergrads tells me this is the go to half drunk place to get food on campus. If that's your thing.

First time here.  This is a cool, different QSR to all of the other chains out there.  The burgers & fries tasted good, and the shakes were awesome (banana pudding is the one we had).  My wife had the 1/4 lb burger, and I had the double that was on the combo list.  The burgers weren't huge by any means, nor were they remarkable, but they were good (and different) for the price.  The fries weren't greasy and had a nice crisp to them.  We had to try the shakes, but we ended up getting the same one.  Banana pudding was probably one of the best "fast-food" shakes I've had.  There were chunks of banana & cookies in it, especially at the bottom.  We had to use a spoon!  We each had a combo of a burger, fries (double order), and a shake, all for $13 and change.  I thought the price was good for what we received.The place was packed at 2pm!  I think most of it was due to a lot of Belmont students being there for some reason, but the place was still busy even after they left.  There was something a little screwy with their drive-thru area.  They had an attendant outside asking every person that came through if they were going through the drive-thru or parking.  There were cones set up to divide the two lines (drive-thru & inside dining).  As soon as you pulled into the parking lot, you had to stop to talk with the attendant first.  If more than 2 people happened to turn in at the same time, it'd back up into the street.  I'm not sure if the person is out there every day, but it kind of looked like it.  Maybe, it was only during their rush hour.  Parking was definitely tight.The cashiers weren't rude, but they weren't overly nice either.  They had their "script" of what to say to people, but I didn't notice any of them even cracking a smile.  A mumbled "have a good day" or "my pleasure" is worse than not saying it at all.  The best part about our experience was a guy whose name I found out is DJ.  He was the busboy/custodian (?).  He was practically running around the place non-stop cleaning tables, sweeping, and refilling lids, straws, napkins, etc.  I've never seen a restaurant so busy at 2pm, and I've never (never!) seen someone work as hard as he was in a fast-food place.  It wasn't 10 seconds after someone left a table before he was there cleaning it.  The icing on the cake was that he would briefly stop sweeping or cleaning each time someone passed him to leave, look them in the eye, and say "have a good day/have a nice 4th of July", and he said it with a genuine smile!  A real smile!  These things are like spotting Bigfoot in fast-food restaurants, or even dine-in restaurants for that matter.  The cashiers at the front could definitely learn something from this guy.  Here was DJ, a guy that simply took pride in his work and genuinely seemed to wish people a good day.  That is few and far between these days.  If anyone from the Cook Out company is reading this, DJ needs not only a promotion, but he should be recognized for his work ethic.  Of course, I say the next thing not knowing his complete skillset, but I'd rather see him behind the register or even as a manager rather than the people that were there.
